diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Cholelithiasis, Complete heart block, Sinus bradycardia, Acute exacerbation of HFpEF, Acute kidney injury, Blood loss anemia, Atrial fibrillation, Mechanical mitral valve
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with worsening dyspnea, abdominal pain especially in the RUQ, and symptoms consistent with volume overload. Physical examination findings included RUQ tenderness and absent ascites, which, in conjunction with a past medical history of cholelithiasis, supported the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
